title: STS-125
summary:
STS-125, or HST-SM4 (Hubble Space Telescope Servicing Mission 4), was the fifth and final Space Shuttle mission to the Hubble Space Telescope (HST) and the last solo flight of the Space Shuttle Atlantis.[NASA 4][3]
The launch of the Space Shuttle Atlantis occurred on 11 May 2009 at 2:01 pm EDT.[2][4][5] Landing occurred on 24 May at 11:39 am EDT,[6] with the mission lasting a total of just under 13 days.
